etymologies: late 19th century. From ancient Greek μονόχρους of one colour (from μονο- + χρώς colour from the same stem as χρῶμα colour) + -ic. Compare earlier monochroous, and also earlier monochromic, monochromatic

definitions: Having or showing a single colour; monochromatic. Of a crystal: not exhibiting different colours when viewed in different directions.
